name: PartOperation
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  An abstract class that all parts based on solid modeling inherit from.
description: |
  An abstract class that all parts based on
  solid modeling inherit from.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - TriangleMeshPart
descendants:
  - IntersectOperation
  - NegateOperation
  - UnionOperation
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: PartOperation.RenderFidelity
    summary: |
      The level of detail used to render the solid modeled part.
    description: |
      This property determines the level of detail that the solid modeled part
      will be shown in. It can be set to the possible values of the
      Enum.RenderFidelity enum.

      The default value is Enum.RenderFidelity.Automatic|Automatic, meaning
      the part's detail is based on its distance from the camera as outlined in
      the following table.




                  Distance From Camera
                  Render Fidelity




                  Less than 250 studs
                  Highest


                  250-500 studs
                  Medium


                  500 or more studs
                  Lowest



    codesamples: []
    type: RenderFidelity
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: PluginSecurity
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Appearance
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - CSG
  - name: PartOperation.SmoothingAngle
    summary: |
      An angle in degrees which affects the smooth shading of a solid modeled
      part.
    description: |
      This property represents an angle in degrees for a threshold value between
      face normals on a solid modeled part.
      If the normal difference is less than the value, normals will be adjusted
      to smooth the difference. While a value between 30 and 70 degrees usually
      produces a good result, values between 90 and 180 are not recommended as
      they may cause a "shadowing" effect on unions with sharp edges.

      Note that smoothing does not affect the normals between different
      materials or different colors.



      Class.PartOperation.SmoothingAngle|SmoothingAngle
      = 0



      Class.PartOperation.SmoothingAngle|SmoothingAngle
      = 50

    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: PluginSecurity
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Appearance
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - CSG
  - name: PartOperation.TriangleCount
    summary: |
      The number of polygons in this solid model.
    description: |
      The number of polygons in this solid model.
    codesamples: []
    type: int
    tags:
      - ReadOnly
      - NotReplicated
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Data
    serialization:
      canload: false
      cansave: true
    capabilities:

      - CSG
  - name: PartOperation.UsePartColor
    summary: |
      Sets whether the Class.PartOperation can be recolored using inherited
      color properties.
    description: |
      Sets whether the Class.PartOperation can be recolored using the
      Class.BasePart.Color or Class.BasePart.BrickColor properties. When
      true, the entire union will be colored as per Class.BasePart.Color|Color
      or Class.BasePart.BrickColor|BrickColor. When false, the parts in the
      union will maintain their original colors from before the onion operation
      was performed.
    codesamples: []
    type: boolean
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Data
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - CSG
methods:
  - name: PartOperation:SubstituteGeometry
    summary: |
      Substitutes the geometry of this Class.PartOperation with the geometry
      of another Class.PartOperation.
    description: |
      Substitutes the geometry of this Class.PartOperation with the geometry
      of another Class.PartOperation. This makes it easier to utilize the
      geometry of a solid modeling operation like
      Class.GeometryService:UnionAsync()|UnionAsync(),
      Class.GeometryService:SubtractAsync()|SubtractAsync(), or
      Class.GeometryService:IntersectAsync()|IntersectAsync() but maintain
      properties, attributes, tags, and children of the main part such as
      Class.Attachment|Attachments, Class.Constraint|Constraints,
      Class.ParticleEmitter|ParticleEmitters, light objects, decals, and more.
      This approach also circumvents the potential "flicker" of completely
      replacing the original Class.PartOperation with another.

      Note that if you're calling this method on a Class.PartOperation with
      child Class.Attachment|Attachments or Class.Constraint|Constraints,
      you should calculate the affected instances with
      Class.GeometryService:CalculateConstraintsToPreserve()|CalculateConstraintsToPreserve(),
      then drop those whose recommended parent is nil.
    codesamples:
      - PartOperation-SubstituteGeometry
    parameters:
      - name: source
        type: Instance
        default:
        summary: |
          The Class.PartOperation whose geometry will substitute the geometry
          of this Class.PartOperation.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Unsafe
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - CSG
events: []
callbacks: []
